title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Markets are plunging worldwide after ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry reveals $1.1 billion bet against AI stocks
items.description: Wall Street expects tech stocks to take a hammering this morning—again.

items.title: Trump’s Sweeping Tariffs Face High-Stakes Supreme Court Test
items.description: Justices will hear arguments on Wednesday over whether the president acted legally when he used a 1977 emergency statute to unilaterally impose tariff...

items.title: Former FBI special agent says he used a simple trick to get the best hotel rooms in the world—and it’s all about showing love to the front desk
items.description: According to licensed private investigator Tom Simon, "I've been doing this for 20 years and the rooms I get are majestic, man."

items.title: A Woman Tells of Torture and 2½ Years of Captivity by an Iraqi Militia

items.title: Ulta Beauty CEO Kecia Steelman went from earning $8 an hour to running the U.S.’s largest beauty retailer
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

items.title: What to Know About Kataib Hezbollah, the Iraqi Militia That Held Tsurkov Captive
items.description: Kataib Hezbollah, a hard-line Iraqi militia linked to Iran, held Elizabeth Tsurkov, a citizen of Israel and Russia, hostage for more than two years.

items.title: Mamdani’s Historic Win, and Democrats’ Big Night Nationwide
items.description: Plus, a race to save artifacts from the ocean.

items.title: Meet OpenAI’s master builder: Greg Brockman is steering a $1.4 trillion infrastructure surge with stakes that go far beyond AI
items.description: As OpenAI's president, Brockman is steamrolling toward "completing the mission" of moving beyond AI to artificial general intelligence (AGI).

items.title: Abigail Spanberger Flips Virginia, Becomes State’s First Female Governor
items.description: In her campaign, Abigail Spanberger focused on jobs and the cost of living and emphasized her support for abortion rights.

items.title: Corcoran Group CEO says Gen Z and millionaires alike are flocking back to the city—but return-to-office mandates aren’t the main reason
items.description: CEO of one of the nation’s largest realtors says New York’s gravitational pull is back—but it’s career insurance, not RTO, driving people to return.
